get.summary: Lists all Accounts in a specific Auth Method.

post.summary: Creates a single Account in the provided Auth Method.
Sets the password for the provided Account.
Sets the password for the provided Account.
Creates a single Auth Method.
Authenticate a user to an scope and retrieve an authentication token.

parameters.name: auth_method_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Auth Method in the system that should be used for authentication.

post.summary: Creates a single Group.
Adds members to a Group.
Removes the specified members from a Group.
Set a Group's members to exactly the list of provided in the request, removing any members that are not specified.

get.summary: Gets a list of Host Catalogs.

post.summary: Creates a Host Catalog

get.summary: List all Host Sets under the specific Catalog.

post.summary: Create a Host Set.
Adds existing Hosts to a Host Set.
Removes Hosts from the Host Set.
Sets the Hosts on the Host Set.

get.summary: List all Hosts for the specified Catalog.

post.summary: Create a single Host.
Creates a single Role.
Adds grants to a Role
Adds Users and/or Groups to a Role.
Removes grants from a Role.
Removes the specified Users and/or Groups from a Role.
Set grants for a Role, removing any grants that are not specified in the request.
Set Users and/or Groups to a Role, removing any principals that are not specified in the request.

get.summary: Lists all Scopes within the Scope provided in the request.

post.summary: Creates a single Scope.
Cancels a Session.
Creates a single Target.
Adds existing Host Sets to a Target.
Authorizes a Session.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the target. Required unless some combination of scope_id/scope_name and name are set.

post.summary: Removes Host Sets from the Target.
Sets the Host Sets on the Target.
Creates a single User.
Associates an Account to a User.
Removes the specified Accounts from being associated with the provided User.
Set the Accounts associated to the User to exactly the list of provided in the request, removing any Accounts that are not specified.

grant_scope_id.description: The Scope the grants will apply to. If the Role is at the global scope, this can be an org or project. If the Role is at an org scope, this can be a project within the org. It is invalid for this to be anything other than the Role's scope when the Role's scope is a project.

principal_ids.description: Output only. The IDs (only) of principals that are assigned to this role.

principals.description: Output only. The principals that are assigned to this role.

grant_strings.description: Output only. The grants that this role provides for its principals.

grants.description: Output only. The parsed grant information.

id.description: Output only. The ID of the Scope.

type.description: Output only. The type of the Scope.

name.description: Output only. The name of the Scope, if any.

id.description: Output only. The ID of the Session.

target_id.description: Output only. The ID of the Target that created this Session.

scope.description: Output only. Scope information for this resource.

created_time.description: Output only. The time this resource was created.

updated_time.description: Output only. The time this resource was last updated.

version.description: Version is used when canceling this Session to ensure that the operation is acting on a known session state.

type.description: Output only. Type of the Session (e.g. tcp).

expiration_time.description: Output only. After this time the connection will be expired, e.g. forcefully terminated.

auth_token_id.description: Output only. The ID of the Auth Token used to authenticate.

user_id.description: Output only. The ID of the User that requested the Session.

host_set_id.description: Output only. The Host Set sourcing the Host for this Session.

host_id.description: Output only. The Host used by the Session.

scope_id.description: Output only. The Scope of the Session.

endpoint.description: Output only. The endpoint of the Session; that is, the address to which the worker is proxying data.

states.description: Output only. The states of this Session in descending order from the current state to the first.

status.description: Output only. The current status of this Session.

worker_info.description: Output only. Worker information given to the client.

certificate.description: Output only. The certificate generated for the session. Raw DER bytes.

termination_reason.description: Output only. If the session is terminated, this provides a short description as to why.

controller.api.resources.sessions.v1.Ses.title: Session contains all fields related to a Session resource

status.description: The status of the Session, e.g. "pending", "active", "canceling", "terminated".

start_time.description: Output only. The time the Session entered this state.

end_time.description: Output only. The time the Session stopped being in this state.

id.description: Output only. The ID of the Host Set.

host_catalog_id.description: Output only. The Host Catalog to which this Host Set belongs.

session_id.description: Output only. The ID of the Session.

target_id.description: Output only. The ID of the Target authorizing this Session.

scope.description: Output only. Scope information for this resource.

created_time.description: Output only. The time this resource was created.

user_id.description: Output only. The User for which this Session was authorized.

host_set_id.description: Output only. The Host Set containing the Host being used for this Session.

host_id.description: Output only. The Host whose address is being used as the endpoint for this Session.

type.description: Output only. Type of the Session (e.g. tcp, ssh, etc.).

authorization_token.description: Output only. The marshaled SessionAuthorizationData message containing all information that the proxy needs.

endpoint.description: Output only. The endpoint address that the worker will connect to, useful for setting TLS parameters.

auth_method_id.description: The ID of the Auth Method in the system that should be used for authentication.

token_type.description: This can be "cookie" or "token". If not provided, "token" will be used. "cookie" activates a split-cookie method where the token is split partially between http-only and regular cookies in order to keep it safe from rogue JS in the browser.

credentials.description: Credentials are passed to the Auth Method; the valid keys and values depend on the type of Auth Method.

id.description: The ID of the target. Required unless some combination of scope_id/scope_name and name are set.

name.description: The name of the target. When using this, scope_id or scope_name must be set.

scope_id.description: The scope ID containing the target, if specifying the target by name.

scope_name.description: The scope name containing the target, if specifying the target by name.

host_id.description: An optional parameter allowing specification of the particular Host within the Target's configured Host Sets to connect to during this Session.

google.protobuf.NullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.
